content.description: An easy fun climb where the crux is leaving the ground. Starts right at the toe of the buttress with a boulder problem, or just onto the north side to keep it fourth class, then straight up the blunt ridge. Bring 15-20’ of sling to set up a rappel on one of the many features on top or down climb to descend.
content.protection: A selection of cams up to 4” and a nut tool for cleaning if using a rope.

content.description: Behind Lake Las Vegas, at the edge of the Great Unconformity, in the Rainbow Gardens recreation area lies a couple of small desert towers. The larger chubby-looking tower to the south is Grandstaff Tower. The base is soft sandstone and the top is crumbling conglomerate. The conglomerate is a mixed bag of good rock and choss, cracks will take and hold good gear while cobbles fall off in your hand next to it. The sand stone is basically shit for anything other than moving over it lightly. I had heard that Randy Grandstaff had climbed this years ago. If so, any evidence from his passage is long since gone but I’ve no doubt that folk have been climbing this feature for generations.
